problems.title: Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Given an array of N integers, find the length of the Longest Increasing Subsequence (LIS).

An increasing subsequence is a subsequence where each element is strictly greater than the previous one.

This is a classic DP problem with O(n^2) and O(n log n) solutions.

DP State: dp[i] = length of LIS ending at index i.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
8
10 22 9 33 21 50 41 60

Sample Output
5

Explanation:
One LIS is [10, 22, 33, 50, 60] with length 5.

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n = int(data[0])
    nums = list(map(int, data[1].split()))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.lengthOfLIS(nums))

hintsList: Initialize all dp[i] = 1 (each element is an LIS of length 1 by itself).
For each i, look at all j < i. If nums[j] < nums[i], update dp[i] = max(dp[i], dp[j] + 1). Answer = max(dp).
